contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Paris metro |Name=Les Gobelins |Pic=[[File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 7 - Les Gobelins 04.jpg|275px]] |Day=15 February |Year=1930 |Access= |Municipality=the 13th arrondissement of Paris |Zone=1 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next|7|Place d'Italie|Censier - Daubenton}} | X=151 | Y=117 }} '''Les Gobelins''' is a [[metro station|station]] of the [[Paris Métro]]. It opened on 15 February 1930 as part of a planned section of line [[Paris Métro Line 7|Line 7]], which was temporarily operated as part of [[Paris Métro Line 10|Line 10]] until the completion of the under-[[Seine]] crossing of line 7 from [[Sully - Morland (Paris Métro)|Pont de Sully]] to [[Place Monge (Paris Métro)|Place Monge]]. The station was integrated into line 7 on 26 April 1931. The station is at the crossroads of four main roads: *Avenue des Gobelins *Boulevard Saint Marcel *Boulevard Arago *Boulevard de Port-Royal This station is named after the ''Avenue des Gobelins'', which honours the [[Gobelin]] family who manufactured dyes from the mid 15th century on the banks of the nearby [[Bièvre River]] (now covered in the area). The family manufactured tapestry from 1662, until the [[Gobelins manufactory|factory]] (adjacent to the station) was acquired by [[Louis XIV]].<ref>{{cite book| first=Pierre |last=Miquel |title= Petite Histoire des Stations de Métro (Little History of Metro Stations) |publisher=Editions Albin Michel |year=1993 |language=French}}</ref> ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Metro de Paris - Ligne 7 - Les Gobelins 01.jpg|[[Paris Métro Line 7|Line 7]] platforms at Les Gobelins </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category|Les Gobelins (Paris Metro)}} {{Paris Metro/line 7}} {{coord|48.836400|N|2.352250|E|region:FR_type:landmark_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Les Gobelins (Paris Metro)}} [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1930]] {{Paris-metro-stub}}
